elements.name: C7_context
elements.title: Task C7
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Kallie has struggled to find her footing at our company. She's repeatedly turned in work product containing typos, grammar issues, and content mistakes. The good thing is that I trust that Kallie will make great strides moving forward to improve. Every time I give her feedback or mark up documents for her, she takes my comments very seriously and always does better the next time. I believe she has the will and desire to become a reliable member of our department.

Green Elephant
Kallie's work often contains errors, but she is highly receptive to feedback and improves with every correction, showing a strong will to succeed.


Blue Whale
Kallie: Struggles (typos, grammar, content errors). Takes feedback seriously & improves. Has will/desire to become reliable.


Red Panda
Kallie's work has consistent errors, but she's receptive to feedback and shows strong potential for improvement. Her dedication suggests she'll become a reliable team member.


Golden Fish
Kallie has had difficulty with work quality, showing repeated errors in writing and content. However, she responds well to feedback, improves consistently, and demonstrates strong willingness to grow. With continued support, she has the potential to become a reliable team member.

elements.name: C9_context
elements.title: Task C9
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Joseph Cook is a consistent performer. He always gets the basic job done even though he could do better. He does not take as much time as he should to be at a higher performance level. He has shown only moderate potential which is risky.

Golden Fish
Joseph is a consistent performer who gets the basic job done but does not strive to improve. He has shown only moderate and risky potential.


Blue Whale
Joseph: Consistent, gets basic job done. Could do better, doesn't take time for higher performance. Moderate potential (risky).


Red Panda
Joseph is a consistent, reliable performer who meets basic expectations. However, he lacks initiative for higher performance and shows only moderate, risky potential.


Green Elephant
Joseph Cook consistently meets basic expectations but shows only moderate potential. He completes tasks reliably but doesn't invest enough effort to reach higher performance, posing some risk for advancement.

elements.name: C2_context
elements.title: Task C2
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Bethany Cunningham performs well yet seems content; a career-growth push is needed.

Golden Fish
Bethany, your performance is consistently strong and appreciated. To ensure you continue to grow and reach your full potential here, let's proactively explore new challenges and define a clear career development path.


Red Panda
Bethany, you continue to deliver strong, reliable performance. While meeting expectations, we see significant untapped potential for your growth. Let's discuss your career aspirations and identify challenging opportunities to push your development further and ensure your continued progress.


Green Elephant
Bethany consistently delivers strong results, meeting all expectations. To further her development, we encourage Bethany to proactively seek out new challenges and leadership opportunities. Identifying specific areas for growth and pursuing relevant training will help her advance and maximize her considerable potential within the company.


Blue Whale
Bethany consistently delivers strong performance and maintains a positive attitude. While she appears satisfied in her current role, she would benefit from targeted development opportunities to stimulate career growth and expand her responsibilities. Encouraging her to pursue stretch assignments or leadership training could help unlock her full potential.

elements.name: C5_context
elements.title: Task C5
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Logan Russell’s consistency is improving; responds well to coaching—continued mentoring will accelerate progress.

Green Elephant
Logan, we are very pleased with the marked improvement in your consistency. You respond well to coaching, and continued mentoring is key to accelerating your progress. Let's maintain this positive momentum.


Blue Whale
Logan, it's positive to see your consistency improving steadily. Your responsiveness to coaching is a key strength. Continuing with focused mentoring will be essential to accelerate this progress further and solidify your performance foundation. Keep up the good work applying feedback.


Red Panda
Logan has shown commendable improvement in consistency, particularly in project delivery and adherence to timelines. He responds exceptionally well to feedback, actively implementing suggestions to refine his approach. Continued mentorship will be key to accelerating his development and fully leveraging his potential within the team.


Golden Fish
Logan Russell is showing improved consistency and responds positively to feedback. His openness to coaching is a strength, and with continued mentoring, he will further accelerate his development and performance.

elements.name: C16_context
elements.title: Task C16
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: My friend and colleague, Matthew Reid, is a great addition to any team. His work is quite impressive, never late, and some of the finest on our division. However, with such a great work ethic that he fails to apply fully to reaching a higher position in this company, I believe he has his eyes on other ventures. I would love to recruit and keep Matthew in our company, but I can't trust that we won't pour resources into his success only for him to leave for a bigger company.

Blue Whale
Matthew's work is excellent, but management perceives a lack of ambition to grow within the company, creating mistrust about his loyalty. This stalls his growth. If he wishes to stay, Matthew should proactively discuss his long-term career goals with his manager to build confidence.


Golden Fish
Feedback means Matthew produces exceptional, timely work but appears uncommitted to advancement, suggesting he may leave for other ventures. This implies trust issues may limit growth opportunities despite high performance. Matthew should: 1) Clarify career goals with manager next week, 2) Discuss desired internal advancement paths, 3) Propose one initiative showing long-term commitment.


Red Panda
Matthew, this feedback highlights your exceptional work quality and reliability, making you a valuable team member. However, it also suggests a perception that you may not be fully committed to long-term growth within the company, leading to a reluctance to invest further in your development. To address this, Matthew should proactively communicate his career aspirations within the company, seek out opportunities for internal advancement, and demonstrate a clear commitment to his future at the organization.


Green Elephant
Matthew is highly skilled, reliable, and produces top-tier work, making him a valuable team member. However, his ambition may extend beyond the current role, raising concerns about long-term retention. To support his growth and strengthen his commitment, leadership should engage Matthew in a development conversation, clarify advancement opportunities, involve him in strategic projects, and discuss alignment of his goals with the company’s future. This proactive approach can build mutual trust and encourage him to grow within the organization.

elements.name: C18_context
elements.title: Task C18
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: George didn't deliver as well as hoped. However, he displays a great deal of all skills necessary for growth. With time, George will prove to be an asset to the company. Given the opportunity, George has the ability to advance beyond his given skill set.

Golden Fish
George’s recent performance fell short of expectations, but management sees strong underlying skills and high potential for future growth. He should meet with his manager to review what went wrong, and then ask for a new, challenging task to demonstrate his true capabilities.


Red Panda
Feedback means George underdelivered recently but possesses all skills for growth, positioning him as a future asset with advancement potential. This signals patience for development but requires proof of progress. George should: 1) Diagnose delivery gaps with manager immediately, 2) Create biweekly milestone plans for complex tasks, 3) Seek one skill-stretching project quarterly.


Blue Whale
George, your performance didn't meet expectations, but your manager recognizes your strong foundational skills and potential for significant growth. This feedback implies that while your current output needs improvement, you are seen as a valuable long-term asset with high advancement potential. To respond, George should: (1) Proactively seek clarification on specific areas for improvement, (2) Request opportunities to apply and develop his skills, (3) Set clear, measurable goals for his immediate contributions, and (4) Regularly check in with his manager on progress.


Green Elephant
George’s current performance hasn’t met expectations, but he demonstrates strong potential through his foundational skills and readiness to grow. This feedback suggests he is viewed as a developmental candidate with long-term value. To progress, George should seek regular feedback, pursue skill-building opportunities, take initiative on projects, and work to consistently deliver results to build trust and prove reliability.
